ivory.ffg.feature
Interface Feature

All Known Implementing Classes:
OrderedWindowSequentialDependenceFeature, TermFeature, UnorderedWindowSequentialDependenceFeature
public interface Feature

Abstract feature definition. Feature values are computed using a sliding window or an indexed document.

Author:
Nima Asadi

Method Summary
 float computeScoreWithMiniIndexes(int[][] positions, int[] query, int dl, GlobalStats stats)
          Computes the feature value using a (mini-)indexed document.
 float computeScoreWithSlidingWindow(int[] document, int[] query, int[] hashedQuery, GlobalStats stats)
          Computes the feature value using a sliding window given a document, query and a scoring function
 void initialize(ScoringFunction score)
          Initializes this feature.
 

Method Detail

computeScoreWithMiniIndexes

float computeScoreWithMiniIndexes(int[][] positions,
                                  int[] query,
                                  int dl,
                                  GlobalStats stats)
Computes the feature value using a (mini-)indexed document.

Parameters:
positions - Positions of each term in the query
query - Original query terms
dl - Document length
stats - Global statistics
Returns:
Feature value

computeScoreWithSlidingWindow

float computeScoreWithSlidingWindow(int[] document,
                                    int[] query,
                                    int[] hashedQuery,
                                    GlobalStats stats)
Computes the feature value using a sliding window given a document, query and a scoring function

Parameters:
document - Flat array representation of a document vector.
query - Original query terms (used to retrieve global statistics)
hashedQuery - Hashed query terms (the same as query for techniques that don't use hashing)
stats - Global statistics
Returns:
Feature value

initialize

void initialize(ScoringFunction score)
Initializes this feature.

Parameters:
Scoring - function
